title: 108_hr903
content: The Act titled "Sandpoint Land and Facilities Conveyance Act of 2003" involves the conveyance of the Sandpoint Federal Building and adjacent land in Sandpoint, Idaho. The Sandpoint Land and Facilities Conveyance Act of 2003 transfers administrative jurisdiction of the Sandpoint Federal Building and 3.17 acres of land to the Secretary of Agriculture. The Secretary assumes the debt repayment obligation for the property transferred. The Secretary is authorized to convey the property transferred to them by the Sandpoint Land and Facilities Conveyance Act of 2003. The conveyance can be done through sale or exchange, and a map of the property will be available for public inspection until the conveyance is completed. The Secretary may solicit offers for the conveyance of property under specific terms and conditions, rejecting inadequate offers not in the public interest. If the property is sold, the recipient must pay fair market value as determined by the Secretary, which can be in cash or other forms of consideration. The Secretary may solicit offers for the conveyance of property under specific terms and conditions, rejecting inadequate offers not in the public interest. If the property is sold, the recipient must pay fair market value as determined by the Secretary, which can be in cash or other forms of consideration. Conditions on exchange include the construction of administrative facilities subject to terms prescribed by the Secretary, completion of facilities to the Secretary's satisfaction, and ensuring an equal value exchange. The value of property to be conveyed must be determined by an appraisal acceptable to the Secretary and conforming to Uniform Appraisal Standards. Additionally, any outstanding indebtedness on the property must be assumed by the entity acquiring it. The Secretary may accept a cash equalization payment exceeding 25% of the property value. Proceeds from property conveyance will be deposited in the Sisk Act fund for acquisition, construction, or improvement purposes. The funds deposited under this subsection are for acquiring, constructing, or improving administrative facilities and land in the Northern Region of the Forest Service in Idaho, as well as acquiring land for addition to the National Forest System in the same region. These funds cannot be distributed to States or counties or considered as moneys received from units of the National Forest System for specific purposes. The Secretary shall manage acquired land in accordance with the Weeks Act and other laws related to the National Forest System. The conveyance of property under this section is subject to laws applicable to National Forest System land, excluding Part 1955 of title 7, Code of Federal Regulations.
